Ready to Get on the Path to Increasing Conversions?

Why do I need conversion rate optimization?

CRO is still not on most small businesses radars – but it shold be. This quick Q&A covers a lot of the basics. If you have any additional questions don’t hesitate to reach out.

What’s the purpose of this conversion rate optimization calculator?

Conversion rate optimization, while becoming more known, is still a foreign concept to most small businesses.

 

When they think of increasing sales opportunities, they turn to increasing ad spend.

 

The beauty of CRO is that you can yield more sales/leads without needing to increase your total opportunities.

 

This calculator is meant to demonstrate that concept with real-world data and hard numbers.

How do you calculate conversion rate optimization (CRO)?

The formula for conversion rate percentage is pretty simple.

 

CR% = Total Website Traffic ÷ Total Number of Conversions x 100

How do you calculate a percentage increase in conversion?

Calculating the percentage increase would require you to first know the conversion rate % prior to your experiment, and then the conversion rate % after the experiment has concluded.

 

% increase = Increase ÷ Original Number × 100.

How does conversion rate affect revenue?

Improving your conversion rate means you’re improving the frequency in which a visitor performs a certain action. Most businesses will measure this against direct sales or leads.

 

Increasing your conversion rate from 1% to 2% effectively doubles the amount of sales revenue or leads generated for the same number of visitors. So essentially, you spend less to earn those customers and earn more in the process. It’s a win win.

What is the goal of conversion rate optimization?

The goal of conversion rate optimization is to improve the efficiency of your marketing efforts and lower customer acquisition costs. By optimizing your conversion rate you can increase revenue per visitor, acquire more customers, and grow your business.

What are the steps of conversion rate optimization?

At a very high level, the steps can be defined as:

  • Define your objective
  • Form a hypothesis
  • Design your tests
  • Establish your baseline
  • Analyze your data

This process can then be rinse-and-repeated as many times as necessary to help you achieve your CRO goals.

Do you offer conversion rate optimization services?

We absolutely do. You can learn more about our conversion rate optimization services here.

Are you ready for a memorable website?

Find out how we can help you achieve your goals by getting a free conversion optimization report prepared by Mike, our co-founder.
